comment: Quizzes, tests, group project, papers. Open book everything, lots of extra credit opportunities. Took it online and would do it again (highly recommend). Toughest part was my group for the project. You get to pick, so pick wisely. Project isn't bad, just get it done early. He's very understanding if you email him with issues. Loved this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took his class online and found it very easy. Weekly homework assignments, 2 tests all semester, and only 10 discussion posts/responses to classmates not due until end of semester (I knocked them all out at once). There is a group project, so make sure you pick a solid team. Overall, would recommend!

There were weekly online quizzes and only two tests. He provides a test review on D2l that basically walks you through how to do the test. One group project that's 45% of your grade, so I can see why a good team is important. I was lucky and got an awesome team. He gives good feedback on your paper and overall it was an easy class. I made an A.

Tests were much more difficult than quizzes, they don't give a good expectation for how the test will be. He asked students if they wanted to switch groups very late in the semester and then put them in a group of 2 when other groups were 6. He combined both online classes then had students email each other to find groups, it was a mess!

Vic Marshall took over my class when my original prof. got sick. He's a tough grader on the Group paper. Ask questions, and make sure to make necessary adjustments for the final Group paper. This boosted our grade a lot. If you had a good time, and put in the effort, you'll get an A. Didn't even open my book.

As stated by previous reviews. Grade dropped from an A to a B solely from team feedback.  Made A's on everything else in the class.  If your group doesn't rate you as high as possible you will lose points.  The system is flawed.  Ask for helpclarification on topics and expect vague or rude responses.  There are better management professors at KSU.

You might think you are going to make an A. But just wait until the day grades are due and watch your grade drop by an entire letter grade or two lol.  Just tell your group members to rate you high because they control your grade,  not how hard you work.  That's the point of this class.

ONLINE CLASS -- Group projectsproblems throughout the semester. The plant visit project is useful, applies to real world, and combines all concepts together. He was not incredibly involved, but it was online; not sure what an on campus class with him is like. EASY A!
He deducts points for no reason at all.  He basically lets the students in the group determine your grade.  The students basically teach the class while he gets a free check.

TAKE HIM! Online course was organized and easy to follow. Weekly 20 question quiz, discussion posts (post 3 times and read 20 other post 100) and team problem. Make sure you pick a good team because you have to work with them weekly on problems and complete a group project. Tests: Online midterm and final. Open book quizzes and tests!

His ppt lectures are very boring, and do not always follow textbook. He's a very old school, stern professor. There is a team project/paper where you will need to visit a factory or manuf. plant. He will deduct points if words are misspelled or posts are off topic. Final is 30%.

Most of the reviews here are for his MGT3100 course. I would not recommend taking MGT3200 online with him as 40% of your grade is almost out of your control due to team problems and projects. I lucked out and got a good team but if I didn't an A would have been impossible as he is a fairly strict grader. Figure this would be u would want to know.
Took online. Alot of busy work (quiz, discussion, team problem due EVERY week). Final is in person, which sucks.  Project is huge part of your grade, so pick team members wisely.

Took online and extremely easy, but a lot of busy work. Literally if you just do your work you'll get an A. I took in the summer. Two open note/book exams online at home. Weekly discussions and learnsmart modules which you get 100 on for just doing it. Group project kind of hard, pick team mates wisely. Easy A.
Took online. Very easy A. Choose teammates wisely for group project. TAKE HIM!!

I've taken MGT 3100 and 3200 with him and overall its not bad. I definitely preferred 3100 because it was much more simple and to the point. MGT 3200 requires alot of team interaction online and when your stuck with a bad team then your screwed the rest of the semester b/c the team project is 20% and team problems were 20%. I hated it! 6/10
I took the online summer class and I would highly recommend taking his class. There is a lot of work but it is easy work. Tests were easy and no final exam just a team project.

Professors Marshall was great. Took this class online. It took a little while getting used to navigating around Vista for his class but once you figure it out everything is very well organized. One final exam on campus. He gives tons of bonus points and opportunities to bring up your grade. Definitely recommend

Best professor, by far I have had at KSU.  I took Mgt 3100 and 3200 with him and oun that his organization was top notch.  I wish he was teaching more business classes!  You know what is expected and as long as you do it - you will earn an A.  He is fair, but expects students to understand what is expected.  What a concept, right? A+++

Class is pretty easy-his expectations are well-lined out in his syllabus. Vista setup is very detailed so make sure to get familiar with his setup before semester starts. Weekly reading/graded discussions and online chapter quizes. 2 exams for semester and they are online openbook. Very easy class, just keep up with deliverables.

I took him online, and it wasn't that bad. Each chapter requires about 100 study questions to be answered and at least 2-3 discussion questions, and he assigns 1 or 2 chapters per week. Tests are pretty long but they come straight out the book. There's a group project that requires community service, a paper, and powerpoint presentation to be done

I took this class online.  Professor Marshall was a good teacher but a little too organized.  Quizzes and discussions were easy.  There is a lot of team work due but it isn't too bad if your on a good team like I was.  Highly recommend!

Took online. Not a bad professor, but the material is insanely boring and the class work is scattered throughout Vista -- found it difficult to find some things. Be in a good group, and you'll be okay. You may leave the group and go solo if you wish.

I liked this professor overall. He did not like to repeat information that was available in the resources he had already provided, but was very responsive on other topics. Very good about adjusting test grades when the key was incorrect. I would take him again.

The material was very uninteresting. Team problems worked well with a good team and quizzes were okay.  Graded discussions were straight forward once I understood the grading system. The professor usually referred students to the syllabus rather than answer simple questions. I got a good grade, but I doubt I'll remember almost anything from this.

Took him online. Very little student interaction. Requires 6 very short and pointless discussions per chapter. Group work is required for a community service project - it'll be difficult to get past this class with a group who doesn't work or communicate. Although, very easy grader on team project - 100. Easy class, invisible professor.

Took the class online; There are regular assignments but once you get into a good routine the load is fine. There is a huge team aspect to the class so choose your team members carefully. I enjoyed this professor.

I took the class online. It was decent, and Marshall does an OK job of getting the material online. He needs more organization for projects. In fact, the projects were just a big waste of time for an online class. 4/10
Great Prof and Great Class!  Very well organized and seamless environment (I took it online).  There is a lot of reading and a group project, but the class could not be laid out any better!

He gave me a penalty point because he did not like my peer review of my team members; that sucked because some of them were slackers. Unfortunately, that point was the difference between an A or a B; I got the B. I was pissed off, but I got over it. Other than that, he was a good professor. I would take him again.
Great professor; very organized, very knowledgeable, very helpful, offers extra credit throughout semester. The class is time consuming, but if you do all the work you'll get an A.
I actually learned a lot in this class. Same as everyone else said, easy weekly quizzes. Discussion board (cuz I took it online). Good class, easy grader.

I took this class online and it was A LOT of work! Each week you must read a chapter (or two), take a timed quiz, & post 6 comments. The quizzes are pretty difficult, only because they are SO VAGUE! Sometimes the info wasn't even covered in the chapter! In addition you must work with a group on a community service project, take a HUGE midterm/final

There is a group project, got kicked out of my group, and did better than they did. do the work and your good. there is A LOT of work if your on your own, but it is do able, an hour few hours a week takes care of it. You will use your book. but not the work book that comes with it. final paper not that hard, study guides too boot. easy do your work
Awesome teacher!!!Weekly quizzes(which are easy)...not too much work...highly recommend him!!

Online MGT 3100 Spring '07--Mr. Marshall is a very helpful & easy teacher. However, online classes require a lot of self discipline to keep on track. Weekly discussions are required (have to post 4 or more discussions in the length of 4000 characters), 2 tests were given (we had up to 2 weeks to complete), and a group TSLP is required.

I learned lots in his class.  Easy going personality and very approachable.  Real world professional.  He gives review sheet/powerpoint/homework to study for the exams.  Upside: grades not as heavily weighted on in-class exams compared to other classes.  Downside: Weekly quizzes, weekly case,service journal, plant tour may keep you busy.

He is great. If you follow thru you can make an A. Not to much work but you learn a lot. If you take MGT 4160 you will not have almonst any tests. If you take 3200 you will. He is nice, helpfull, and flexible. I love it.

I have never taken Vic for a class before but he was in my MBA program and I worked on several projects with him. He is one of the nicest and most helpful people around. If you have the oppertunity to take his class I highly recommend it.
